items.title: Canada's top public servant says budget will result in 40,000 job cuts, programs terminated
items.description: The head of the federal public service says the budget commitment to spend less and invest more will result in the loss of 40,000 jobs as programs are scaled back or eliminated.

items.title: Governments Of Canada and Manitoba Strengthening Justice for Canada's First Responders
Here's how Carney's budget aims to tackle youth unemployment
items.description: Budget 2025 proposes nearly $1.6 billion in funding for the youth job market in Canada as unemployment for young Canadians nears 15 per cent.

items.title: New national emergency alert system proposed in federal budget
items.description: The federal budget is proposing more than $55 million for a new national emergency alert system, making good on a recommendation from the committee that examined the 2020 mass shooting in Nova Scotia.

items.title: Canada's men collect their 1st-ever FIFA U17 World Cup win
items.description: Elijah Roche scored in the 88th minute and Marius Aiyenero converted a penalty in stoppage time as Canada pulled off a Houdini-like 2-1 win over Uganda on Wednesday for its first-ever victory in nine trips to the FIFA U-17 World Cup.

items.title: Manitoba Government Expands Care for Dialysis Patients and Mothers in Norway House Cree Nation
Alberta hospital, nursing staff vote 98% in favor of striking ahead of mediation
items.description: About 16,000 Alberta hospital workers, including licensed practical nurses and health-care aides, have voted overwhelmingly to strike if necessary to back contract demands.

items.title: First snowfall of the season expected in the GTA this week: Environment Canada
items.description: The GTA could see its first snow this weekend as colder air moves in with a weekend forecast of flurries expected to arrive Sunday.

items.title: Canada's immigration system is lost in the bushes
Get Ready for Harper-Style Public Service Cuts, Says Analyst
items.description: Budget 2025 proposes cutting 40,000 government jobs.

items.title: The Military Wins and Public Programs Lose in Carney’s Budget
items.description: But will the Liberals find enough support to survive a non-confidence vote?

items.title: Thousands of Alberta nursing care staff vote in favour of strike
items.description: Nursing care staff represented by the Alberta Union of Provincial Employees have voted 98 per cent in favour of strike action in a vote this week.

items.title: Federal budget charts difficult path out of current crisis — with small margin of error
Manitoba Government Invests More Than $1.3 Million for Community Revitalization Projects in Westman
Infrastructure, jobs may be focus of Ontario's fall fiscal update
items.description: Ontario's finance minister recently highlighted infrastructure spending and protecting jobs as areas the federal budget falls short.

items.title: St. Mary's fish plant destroyed by fire as crews face hurricane-force winds in N.L.
items.description: The fish plant in the Newfoundland community of St. Mary's has burned to the ground as the community faces hurricane force winds and heavy rain, Mayor Steve Ryan told CBC News Tuesday night.

items.title: Manitoba Government to Help Students Learn About Climate Change and Climate Action in Schools
Waves could reach 12 metres high on N.L. south coast as heavy winds, rain persist
items.description: CBC meteorologist Ashley Brauweiler warns of a storm surge from the Burin Peninsula to the southern Avalon that could bring waves as high as 12 metres breaking along the shore.

items.title: Toronto is facing a ‘freeze' as it looks to increase its landfill capacity
items.description: The City of Toronto expects to run out of landfill space by 2035, and despite approving a “long term waste plan” in 2016, city officials are still searching for solutions.

items.title: The Beaches make a play for Canadian rock royalty at Doug Mitchell
items.description: The Beaches are making more than just waves.

items.title: Budget 2025 made some changes to tax policy. What does it mean for you?
items.description: Tax policy experts say that while this year’s budget has 'not a lot for the average person' in terms of tax policy, some minor changes could end up affecting your tax bill.

items.title: Will Carney’s Budget of Contradictions Sink His Government?
items.description: With a mega-deficit, big job cuts and more military spending, critics have lots to attack.

items.title: Infants Bear the Brunt of RSV Hospitalizations, UBC Study Finds
items.description: Researchers say the province should do more to protect the very small and vulnerable.

items.title: What Budget 2025 promises for border security and traveller screening
items.description: The budget says new funding will go toward 'digital solutions to maximize efficiency in security screening activities' and developing a new preclearance system for travellers.

items.title: ‘Our hearts are shattered': Fashion dog Tika the Iggy dies
items.description: Tika the Iggy, an Italian Greyhound who has become popular on social media for her fashionable style, died earlier this month a few days after tumours were removed from her liver.

items.title: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigns from Conservative caucus to join the Liberals
items.description: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigned from the Conservative caucus Tuesday — and he's joining the Liberals.
